images.copyright: The Circle Bridge in Copenhagen, Denmark (© Lingxiao Xie/Getty Images)
images.title: Going round in circles
images.caption: A circular celebration
images.desc: This striking bridge connecting areas around Copenhagen Harbour in the Danish capital is something of a work of art which, when seen side on, gives the impression of a ship by the quay. Its five interconnected circles each has its own ‘mast’ complete with steel cables threaded to the platforms. The circles vary in size and are arranged in a zig zag, designed to make the thousands of pedestrians and cyclists who use the route each day slow down for a moment of reflection. The central section also swings back to allow boats to pass through.
